inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: patient is a 25-year-old G1 P1 pregnant woman

inclusion.criterion: fever; headache, vomiting, chills/rigors, and/or any of the following signs: temperature >37.50C and <39.50C, Hb>5 and <9 g/dl
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patients is a 25-year-old G1 P1 pregnant woman who is 24W3D gestational old who developed a sudden unset of fever and chills, accompany with nausea and vomiting.

inclusion.criterion: positive blood smear for P.falciparum with at least 1000 asexual parasites/uL in an asymptomatic woman
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: severe and complicated forms of malaria (as defined by WHO, 1996)
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient is a pregnant woman with symptoms of fever, headache, vomiting, chills/rigors, and abnormal vital signs. She has a positive blood smear for P.falciparum but the density is unknown.
